jobs.description:
Il personale è il cuore pulsante delle nostre attività operative e la formazione è essenziale affinché ogni dipendente possa dare il meglio di sé. In qualità di Trainer per Amazon, svolgerai un ruolo cruciale nell’onboarding e nel potenziamento delle competenze dei nostri dipendenti. Ti assicurerai che i nostri dipendenti dispongano delle competenze e delle conoscenze necessarie per tutelare la propria sicurezza, per operare in modo efficiente e perché sappiano cogliere opportunità di crescita professionale in Amazon, fino a diventare, eventualmente, i nostri futuri leader. Affiancherai persone in ogni fase della carriera, dai neoassunti ai manager.

Il ruolo ruota su turni: mattina, pomeriggio, notte e include anche i weekend.

Key job responsibilities
- Garantire formazione e coaching secondo gli standard di Amazon.
- Esaminare le percentuali di completamento dei programmi formativi nelle varie sedi e migliorarli, in collaborazione con manager e altri membri del team.
- Raccogliere feedback ed evidenziare aree con opportunità di miglioramento dell’esperienza formativa.
- Collaborare con i team per individuare ambiti in cui è necessario colmare lacune nella formazione e nella crescita professionale.
- Aiutare a monitorare metriche come: sicurezza, qualità e processi nelle varie sedi.
- Impartire formazione e coaching ai collaboratori affinché possano offrirli a loro volta ai team locali.

A day in the life
Il ruolo di Trainer consiste nell’illustrare gli standard relativi ai nostri processi e garantirne l’applicazione. Erogherai a dipendenti Amazon e collaboratori esterni una formazione di alta qualità, che punti i riflettori sulla sicurezza, la cultura e le procedure in vigore nei singoli siti, assicurando anche un’accoglienza calorosa per i neoassunti. In qualità di Trainer, farai in modo che tutti rispettino gli standard operativi più elevati. Saprai offrire feedback costruttivi per aiutare chi è in fase di formazione a crescere e sviluppare le corrette competenze.

Lavorerai presso una delle nostre sedi operative, dove offrirai formazione in presenza e online a team che coprono diversi turni. All’occorrenza offrirai supporto anche ad altre sedi. Lavorerai in modo autonomo, ma ti interfaccerai regolarmente con il personale e le gli stakeholder della tua sede.

jobs.description:
We are looking for a researcher in state-of-the-art LLM technologies for applications across Alexa, AWS, and other Amazon businesses. In this role, you will innovate in the fastest-moving fields of current AI research, in particular in how to integrate a broad range of structured and unstructured information into AI systems (e.g. with RAG techniques), and get to immediately apply your results in highly visible Amazon products.

If you are deeply familiar with LLMs, natural language processing, and machine learning and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this may be the right opportunity for you. Our fast-paced environment requires a high degree of autonomy to deliver ambitious science innovations all the way to production. You will work with other science and engineering teams as well as business stakeholders to maximize velocity and impact of your deliverables.

It's an exciting time to be a leader in AI research. In Amazon's AGI Information team, you can make your mark by improving information-driven experience of Amazon customers worldwide!

jobs.description:
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA

Are you passionate about operating and enhancing mission-critical data security solutions that protect Amazon's vast infrastructure? This role is Iliad Identity team in Amazon Security and an ideal candidate will be a Microsoft Purview Administrator who can bring their expertise to a setting Purview and RMS in Amazon Security.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for the management and maintenance of our Microsoft Purview applications, with a focus on setting up and maintaining data governance and compliance policies, encryption, and supporting the Microsoft 365 environment in a highly secure, classified environment.

In this pivotal role, you'll be at the forefront of implementing, operating, and continuously improving our data security services, working with both first-party and third-party security solutions. Your work will directly impact the effectiveness and reliability of our endpoint solutions, making a direct impact on the security posture of Amazon and its subsidiaries. If you're passionate about delivering extensible, on-time solutions and have experience working within a high-performance team, we want to hear from you!

Key job responsibilities
- Administer and optimize the deployment, configuration, and performance of our security services across Amazon's global infrastructure and its subsidiaries.
- Design, implement, and test data governance and compliance policies, including data classification, labeling, and DLP policies.
- Setup encryption, on data managed by admin and user level encryption.
- Should have good understanding of cryptography and key management.
- Monitor and optimize these policies to align with regulatory requirements.
- Deploy and configure Microsoft Purview and integrated Microsoft 365 services.
- Administer and manage role groups, custom roles, and permissions within the Purview portal.
- Mitigate risks by protecting sensitive data from internal and external threats.
- Implement information protection and insider risk management solutions


A day in the life
As a Systems Engineer in the ESCAPE team, your day centers on maintaining Amazon's data security posture. You'll monitor system health, address alerts, and collaborate with security engineers, IT, third party vendors, and others to optimize deployments. Tasks include fine-tuning automation scripts, testing new capabilities, and analyzing logs for potential issues. You'll work closely with environment owners to prioritize features and plan deployments. Your customers are Amazon's business units and subsidiaries, whose data you protect. Key challenges involve maintaining system performance at scale, minimizing impact related to changes and deployments, and swiftly responding to issues within our supported infrastructure. Your role is vital in ensuring the reliability and efficiency of Amazon's endpoint security platform across its diverse technology landscape.

About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon Security values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why Amazon Security?
At Amazon, security is central to maintaining customer trust and delivering delightful customer experiences. Our organization is responsible for creating and maintaining a high bar for security across all of Amazon’s products and services. We offer talented security professionals the chance to accelerate their careers with opportunities to build experience in a wide variety of areas including cloud, devices, retail, entertainment, healthcare, operations, and physical stores

Inclusive Team Culture
In Amazon Security, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Ongoing DEI events and learning experiences inspire us to continue learning and to embrace our uniqueness. Addressing the toughest security challenges requires that we seek out and celebrate a diversity of ideas, perspectives, and voices.

Training & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, training, and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.

jobs.description:
The Business Development Manager will lead the growth, performance, and operational excellence of Amazon’s Hub Delivery program across regions in Brazil. Managing a team of Channel Team Leads (CTLs), this leader drives network expansion, ensures delivery quality, and develops high-performing field teams. The role blends strategic planning with selective hands-on support to accelerate launches, resolve escalations, and maintain Amazon’s high standards.

Key job responsibilities
- Lead and develop CTLs, ensuring strong team performance, coaching, and capability building.

- Own multi-region acquisition and expansion strategy, ensuring sustainable growth and high-quality onboarding.

- Drive operational performance, maintaining delivery success metrics of 98.5%+ across all regions.

- Dive deep into data to identify root causes, performance risks, and improvement opportunities.

- Serve as senior escalation point for complex onboarding, partner performance, and operational blockers.

jobs.description:
The Supply Run Manager will oversee the end‑to‑end operations of the Supply Run network within the Hub Delivery program. This role is responsible for managing the fleet of trucks that connect Delivery Stations with Hub Delivery small‑ and medium‑business partners (SMBs) using a milk‑run operating model. Success in this position requires a highly focused, systems‑driven leader who can design scalable processes, identify operational bottlenecks, and drive continuous improvement.

This person will collaborate closely with product, tech, and field operations teams to implement tools and solutions that enhance routing, scheduling, and real‑time visibility. They will also ensure that daily operations run smoothly, safely, and in alignment with broader Hub Delivery goals.

This is a high‑impact role for someone who thrives in fast‑moving environments, enjoys solving complex logistics challenges, and is motivated by building systems that scale.

Key job responsibilities
- Own day‑to‑day operations of the Supply Run network, ensuring reliable, efficient truck movements between Delivery Stations and Hub Delivery SMB partners.

- Design, implement, and refine scalable processes that support a growing milk‑run transportation model.

- Optimize truck utilization and cost efficiency through data‑driven decision‑making, continuous improvement, and operational rigor.

- Collaborate with tech and product teams to identify, influence, and deploy technology solutions that improve routing, scheduling, and visibility.

- Monitor performance metrics (e.g., utilization, on‑time performance, cost per route) and drive corrective actions when needed.

- Develop and maintain SOPs, ensuring consistent execution across all Supply Run operations.

- Partner with field operations and Delivery Station teams to resolve issues, improve handoffs, and maintain service quality.

- Identify bottlenecks and operational risks, proposing and executing mitigation strategies.

- Lead vendor or partner engagement for trucking providers, ensuring compliance with safety, service, and cost expectations.

- Support long‑term network planning, including capacity forecasting, route design, and scalability assessments.

- Champion a culture of safety, accuracy, and continuous improvement

jobs.description:
As a Senior Migration Consultant, you will work with customers and partners, guiding them through planning, preparing and delivery of complex transformation and migration projects based on varying customer needs. You will contribute to build and maintain strong stakeholder relationship with C-level executives to shape their cloud migration and transformation roadmap.

On a daily basis, you will work together with customers to assess their organizational readiness to perform the cloud adoption. You will help them to define goals, objectives and business outcomes. You will develop and align cloud vision together with relevant stakeholders to meet with those outcomes. You identify solutions that help a customer, partner, or an internal team overcome technical as well as organizational challenges. You will collaborate with Subject Matter Experts to support pre-sales activities.

Do you have experience delivering IT solutions in agile environment - plan, organize, and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery?

Come build the future with us.

Eligibility for UK Government Security Clearance is required for this role (https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/united-kingdom-security-vetting-clearance-levels).

Key job responsibilities
You will work with customers and partners internalizing their context while using your business and technical skills to design solutions based on requirements and constraints.
You will own and complete key tasks and deliverables, and collaborate with others to define and implement optimal, complete solutions based on stakeholders needs.
You will work towards customer business outcomes, ensuring there is a strong connection between delivery activities and business objectives.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
